articles.title: U.S. hit for violation of UN charter
articles.content:
U.S. hit for violation of UN charter 
  Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- U.S. violations of UN charter, including military attack on Iraq and act of the U.S. under the veil of the UN in Korea, are a revelation of extreme arrogance and shamelessness.
   Rodong Sinmun today says this in a signed article.
    It goes on:   In 1950 the U.S. set up a "UN command" and shipped multinational forces into the Korean War when there was a vacuum of the Soviet "veto."
   The "UN command" is a product of a plot the U.S. hatched by abusing the name of the UN. 
   Only the U.S. still remains in the "UN command."
   There were not and are not UN instructions issued to the "UN command."
   The UN bears no financial support for the "UN command."
   The "UN command" is the U.S. forces command from a to z.
     The United States' wanton violation of the UN charter has been illustrated by the fact that it has not implemented the resolution of the 30th UN general assembly session on the dismantling of the "UN command" and the withdrawal of the U.S. forces from South Korea, which is a step for a durable peace on the Korean peninsula.
   If the U.S. continues abusing the name of the UN, it will lose confidence from the UN member nations and face bitterer denunciation as the enemy of world peace and security.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's birthday to be celebrated in Equatorial Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's birthday to be celebrated in Equatorial Guinea
  Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the 57th birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il was inaugurated in Equatorial Guinea.
   An inaugural meeting was held on January 12.
   The general secretary of the Democratic Party was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
   The meeting discussed a programme of celebration events.

articles.title: Egyptian figure on Korean people's optimism
articles.content:
Egyptian figure on Korean people's optimism

   Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- General director  Anwar Ibraham of the Egyptian Ministry of Culture, giving  his impressions of Korea, said that the Korean people are now confidently advancing toward a bright future without pessimism about difficulties. 
   The DPRK where everything was destroyed and reduced to ruins, has turned into a beautiful country with many gigantic monumental edifices, he noted.
   The Korean people are solving everything by their own efforts, he said, expressing the belief that they who have been trained under the deep care of the great leaders will successfully put into practice all that they are determined to do.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's reminiscences published in Poland
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's reminiscences published in Poland
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Vol. 2 of part 1 the anti-Japanese revolution from "With the Century", the reminiscences of the President Kim Il Sung, was published by the Cieszyn Printing House in Poland on Jan. 8.

articles.title: Opposition "assemblymen" occupy "speaker's" office in S. Korea
articles.content:
Opposition "assemblymen" occupy "speaker's" office in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- "National Assemblymen" from the opposition "Grand National Party" of South Korea started a sit-in strike after occupying the office of the "speaker of parliament" on Jan. 14, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   After a secret office of the "Agency for National Security Planning" was found inside the building of "parliament" the GNP warned on Jan. 12 that the "National Assembly speaker's" office would be occupied unless the "director of ANSP" is dismissed.
   Confronted with this situation, the "speaker" threatened that he will neither preside over a "parliamentary" session for "the pending interpellation" proposed by the "GNP" nor entrust "deputy speakers" with it unless the sit-in strike is stopped.

articles.title: Officials of land and environmental protection meet
articles.content:
Officials of land and environmental protection meet
  Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Officials of land and environmental protection and its related domains met in Pyongyang on Jan. 17.
   The meeting reviewed successes and experience gained in land management last year and discussed tasks and ways for making a new turning-point in the domain this year. 
   A report by secretary Kye Ung Thae of the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee was followed by speeches at the meeting.
   The reporter and speakers referred to the successes made by working people across the country last year in tree planting,  road building, land adjustment and other work by endeavouring to turn their native places into more beautiful ones good to live in.
   They laid stress on the tasks arising in forest planting and seeding, road building and management, river and stream improvement projects, construction of minor power stations and fish farms, land adjustment, city management and environmental protection.
   They called upon the Ministry of City Management and Land and Environmental Protection, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Forestry and other related domains to put greater efforts into completing all land development projects into ones of eternal value.

articles.title: Quality of Korean youth
articles.content:
Quality of Korean youth
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Young Korean people are performing proud exploits in all domains of socialist construction.
   In hearty response to the Joint New Year Editorial, they filled or cut earth of over 1.07 million cubic metres in face of the difficulties caused by midwinter in recent days and opened a bright prospect for hastening the building of roadbed in the construction of the Pyongyang-Nampho Express Highway, one of major projects.
   The construction of nearly all minor power stations now underway across the country is promoted by the efforts of youths.
   So, lots of minor power stations are called "Youth" power stations.
   The revolutionary enthusiasm and creative activity of young people are a source of successes in the work to increase production in different domains of the national economy in face of difficulties caused by the shortage of everything.
   It is the quality and tradition pertaining to Korean youths to perform heroic exploits in the van of the era and the revolution.
   In the '50s they carried out the project of laying broad-gauge railways in the 80-odd-kilometer-long section between Haeju and Hasong in a matter of 75 days. In the '80s young servicepersons  built the west sea barrage stretching 8 km on the rough sea in five years. 
   In recent years, the Korean youths ensured the first-stage commissioning of the Anbyon Youth Power Station and completed the construction of the Kumgangsan Youth Railways and railway electrification project, overcoming difficulties.
   The Workers' Party of Korea, attaching importance to youth affairs, puts forward young people as a viable unit of society and the hero of future, which makes them performers of exploits and heroes of the era.

articles.title: National Academy of Sciences - comprehensive science research base
articles.content:
National Academy of Sciences - comprehensive science research base
 Pyongyang, January 18 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians of the National Academy of Sciences have turned out to carry out the tasks set forth in the Joint New Year Editorial.
   While giving on-the-spot guidance to the National Academy of Sciences on January 11, General Secretary Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction at many successes achieved by scientists and technicians in the work to raise the nation's science and technology up to the world standard. 
   He had given on-the-spot guidance to the National Academy of Sciences in April, 1995. Since then, the scientists and technicians had achieved innovative successes in scientific researches of electronics, heat engineering and bioengineering.
   The National Academy of Sciences on the outskirts of Pyongyang is a modern and comprehensive science research base in Korea.
   It was established in December 1952.
   Its total floor space is over 153,000 square kilometres. 
   It has hundreds of academies, branch academies and institutes.
   It also has training institutes of cadres in charge of science such as the doctoral institute and the university of science, a retraining school and a large-sized science library. 
   It has a huge army of scientists and technicians,  as well as modern material and technical foundations necessary for research, completion, dissemination and introduction.
   It has thousands of persons with academic degrees or titles, including academicians, doctors and professors.  
   It has made lively exchanges of science with academies of sciences and science research institutes in many countries, including Germany, Peru and Mexico, and international organizations.
